resources.string:
Heterogeneous Adapter is an extension of RecyclerView Adapter intended to make creating lists with different types of items more straightforward. To accomplish this, Heterogeneous Adapter uses Sections to divide items into groups of the same type. Sections behave just like a separate RecyclerView Adapter, with the condition that they can only have one type of item view. Once attached to a Heterogeneous Adapter, Sections display one after another in the order they were added (or the specified order if set manually).


This abstraction allows many behaviors that would normally be tedious and generate significant amounts of unreadable boilerplate code to be implemented with minimal effort. For example, the “Dynamic Entries” header below is only visible when its corresponding Section has content.


Another feature not shown here is that Heterogeneous Adapter includes an Empty State implementation that can be added just as easily as it is to create a new Section.
